newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- Apple, DSC off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- Apple, DSC off.

text.p: Shares in Apple Computer Inc fell preceding Wednesday's market open, surrendering part of Tuesday's sharp rise built on a report about the company's return to profitability that was later refuted by Apple.
Preceding Wednesday's market open, Apple fell one to 23-5/8, cutting into yesterday's 2-7/16 rise.
Apple said it had made no change in its official forecast regarding when the company would return to profitability.
Bloomberg Business News quoted Apple's chief financial officer as saying the company could return to profitability sooner than its previously stated March 1997 target.
Also, DSC Communications Corp fell to 21-5/8 from 23-1/8 on selling related to Goldman Sach's downgrade of the stock to market perform from recommended list, traders said.
OrthoLogic Corp shares fell sharply ahead of the opening bell, to seven from 11-3/8, after the company said last night that it expects third quarter results to be below expectations.
Traders reported no activity in Foundation Health Corp or Health Systems International.
Trading in the shares remained halted because of the news released last of their $2.2 billion stock-swap merger agreement.
Also, Viewlogic shares traded at 9-1/2, off two, after issuing a negative earnings forcast, traders said.
A negative earnings outlook also weighed on the shares of Software 2000, which shed 2-1/4 to 7-3/4 before the open.
